div.l: And she come after in a gyte of reede
And symkyen had hosen of the same
Ther durst no wight clepen hir but dame
Was noon so hardy that went by the wey
That with hir durst ones rage or pley
But ȝif he wolde ben slayn of Symkyn
With panade or with knyf or bodekyn
For ielous folk ben ꝑperelous euermo
Algate thei wolde ther wyfes wenden so
And ek for she was som dele smoterlich
She was a deigne as water in the dich
And full of hoker and of bysmare
Hir thoght that a lady shuld hir spare
What for her kynrede and hir nortelrye
That she had lernyd in nonnerye
A doghter had ther betwyx hem two
Of twenty ȝeer with outen ony moo
Sauyng a child that was of half ȝere age
In cradell hit lay and was a ꝓproper page
Thil wenche thikke and wele y grouen was
With camyse nose and eyen gray as glas
With buttokes brode and brestes rounde ⁊and hie
But right fair was hir here I will noȝt lye
The ꝑperson of the towntown for she was so faire
In purpose was to make hir his eire
Both of his catell and his messuage
And straunge he mayde hit of hir mariage
His purpose was to be stow hir hie
Vn to som worthy bloode of auncetrie
For holy chirche mote ben̄ dispended
Of holy chirche bloode that is descended
Therefore he wolde his hooly bloode honoure
Þoght that he holy chirche shulde deuoure
